title: Failed to import CSV file generated by Brave
content:
So I read on Reddit the intentions of Google with Chrome and adblocker add-ons, and I was worried because Brave (my Android browser until today) is based on Chromium as well. I've always been a Firefox user on desktop, and now on mobile as well since the dev team fixed the rendering errors of Firefox on Android. Ok so here goes my question: I've installed Brave on desktop (Linux) since I want my saved mobile login data on Firefox as well. So I exported a plaintext (unencrypted) *.csv file from Brave desktop and I am unable to import it onto Firefox (also on desktop).

I'm aware of the about:config key to be able to import CSV files to Firefox password manager, and is set to True. But the file does not import at all, so I opened the Browser Console and this is the logger output when I try to import the CSV file(screenshot also available):

``` eval() and eval-like uses are not allowed in the Parent Process or in System Contexts (Blocked usage in “chrome://global/content/third_party/d3/d3.js”) d3.js:2040:16

call to Function() blocked by CSP d3.js:2040 

   parse chrome://global/content/third_party/d3/d3.js:2040    parseRows chrome://global/content/third_party/d3/d3.js:2088    parse chrome://global/content/third_party/d3/d3.js:2038    importFromCSV resource://gre/modules/LoginCSVImport.jsm:161    InterpretGeneratorResume self-hosted:1458    AsyncFunctionNext self-hosted:668

``` Then I looked into a CSV file generated by Firefox and it has the password hashed, so how do I need to proceed?

Is there any tool to convert the CSV contents?


Really, I want to use Firefox on all my devices but this change (for good) came from nowhere...

Hope someone has had this issue and can help me.
creator: tntekprod

title: How do I copy to the clipboard in JavaScript?
content:
How do I copy text to the clipboard (multi-browser)?

Related: How does Trello access the user's clipboardhttps://nyfo.nyc/ nyfo? Nothing special. They can do it by themselves but I want to offer also the possibility of clicking a button without worrying about selecting the correct portion of text. – Santiago Corredoira Dec 31, 2008 at 0:03 8 This long blog post contains a lot of ways to do this: Accessing the System Clipboard with JavaScript – A Holy Grail? – Aaron Digulla Apr 21, 2011 at 8:26 2 It is giving browser undefined exception in IE as well as in FF – Jagadeesh Feb 22, 2013 at 7:43 4 If we can put text into the user's clipboard, we can ruin his clipboard. – Frank Fang Jun 11, 2014 at 12:15 1 Personaly, I prefer 3rd party such as clipboardjs. clipboardjs: clipboardjs.com vue-clipboards: zhuowenli.github.io/vue-clipboards v-clipboard: vuejsexamples.com/a-clipboard-library-with-vue-js – 4givN Jan 23, 2020 at 8:49

title: Firefox downloads PDF even if I just want to read them
content:
My settings are: Downloads : always ask Applications: for all PDF : always ask I also changed browser.download.improvements_to_download_panel to false.

Having gone through all this trouble I now am asked what to do with pdf file. If I opt for "open" however the file is still downloaded to the default folder.

What is the sense of giving options if these are just ignored??????????

I read that the change has been made to save time. This however costs me lots of time. I created a special folder Firefox JUNK that now is my default map. I have to clean this map regularly and when I have something that needs to go in my Downloads I have to choose that map manually.

Also: are you aware that most people have their download folder on the C partition and rarely look at it look at it?
creator: Amazone

title: Crash upon too much memory use, especially while qBittorrent is running
content:
Hi!

I have been experiencing the same error that while qBittorrent is running in the background, especially when multiple torrents are being downloaded and/or uploaded and too much memory is used, Firefox crashes many many times. The crash is strange, there is no popup window stating that FF crashed, just it gets closed. So I cannot present an error log. The first sign of this upcoming crash is that the FF window gets bigger, the bottom Windows taskbar disappers and FF freezes, then it becomes normal again and then it closes without warning. This same error could be experienced since at least 5 or 6 previous versions of FF. Although with every update it became scarcer, but still it can be experienced.

Thanks for your help in advance.
creator: kadocsa.krisztian

title: Can't Enable Two-Factor-Authentication.
content:
The only thing stopping me from switching to FireFox is this issue, whenever I try to enable 2-factor-auth I keep getting a message saying "Incorrect two-step authentication code".

I tried restarting my PC, restarting my phone, used 3 different auth apps, restarted my router, used a VPN, cleared cache and cookies, tried enabling it from a different browser, tried using a different phone, tried enabling it on a different account, and nothing fixed the issue, I keep getting the same error message "Incorrect two-step authentication code"

at this point I'm 99% sure it's a server sided issue.

help me, this is taking way too long to just activate 2-factor-authentication :(

title: Whatsapp web does not work in firefox private browsing
content: Whatsapp web https://web.whatsapp.com/ does not work in firefox private browsing, as described here https://github.com/webcompat/web-bugs/issues/103595. The page attempts to load several times, then stops with a URL https://web.whatsapp.com/?logout_reason=0. It works in Firefox normal mode and in MS Edge, both private and normal mode. What I have done: Uninstalled all extensions Re-installed Firefox Refreshed Firefox Firefox 104.02 64 bit This is a known issue and has been around for half a year. Please fix it. I'm using Firefox mostly for privacy reasons, and not being able to use it in private mode is ironic and defeats the purpose. Looking forward to a solution. Thanks

title: How do I delete an autofill email address?
content:
Running v104.0.2. (UK) Whenever I have an 'email box', I get an autofill email address appearing I wish to delete. When I highlight the address, and hit 'delete' it doesn't work. On searching a method, I get the suggestion to go into settings and drill down in the 'Forms & Autofill' section in 'privacy' settings, but my FireFox has no such section.

I then tried to 'activate' the section by going into 'about:config' and changing 'extensions.formautofill.available' from, 'detect', to 'on', it made no difference, I still have no 'Forms & Autofill' section in settings.

How can something so simple be so complicated?

How do I delete an autofill email address?

title: How do I restore my session and recover my open tabs, after a crash, using backed-up files?
content: After Firefox crashed today I restarted it and I got a session and tabs that I last used over a month ago, and none of the simple fixes worked. But not to worry, I thought, because important folders (including Firefox's Profiles folder) get backed up automatically every night, and just yesterday I reset my "homepage" to include all the currently open tabs. So I thought restoring my session and recovering my open tabs would be a simple matter of replacing current files with backed-up versions of those files. But I can't figure out which files to use or if that strategy is even possible. For example, some of the support materials state that recovery.jsonlz4 in the sessionstore-backups folder gets updated continuously with session and tabs information, but on my system that file abruptly stopped being updated in July. Similarly, previous.jsonlz4 and upgrade.jsonlz4-*** stopped being updated in May. (FYI, sessionstore.jsonlz4 gets created when I close Firefox, just like it's supposed to, but I don't have any backed-up versions of it because it only exists when Firefox is closed.) And the tabs currently listed in the "homepage" are also from a month ago, and I can't figure out what file those tabs are stored in. Help!

title: Netflix saying, "Looks like your browser is no longer supported.  Error Code F7121-3078" after latest Widevine update
content:
I have the latest version of Firefox 78.15.0esr (64-bit) on my Macbook Pro. Netflix says, "Looks like your browser is no longer supported. Please install the latest version or install another browser. Error Code F7121-3078" (see image 1).

Netflix streaming works fine on Opera, but I can't get it working on Firefox, even though it was working fine on Firefox a couple of days ago (Sept 15, 2022). Any help you can offer would be appreciated very much. I have two plug ins: Facebook Container and EFF Privacy Badger. There is no update available to update Firefox. It appears that when the new version of Widevine updated yesterday (see image 2), the browser stopped working for streaming on Netflix. Widevine version 4.10.2209.1 (updated Sept 16, 2022).

title: Firefox Window Gets Smaller When Fullscreen
content:
See the iCloud link to the video: https://share.icloud.com/photos/0d3_aWWS8K4Lme-df7JUrFcvQ.

When Firefox is full screen, the size is fine. Eventually, the size gets smaller: the bezels on the right and left become bigger. The only way to fix is to restore the window to original size, then maximize again.
